definition[0]: to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
example[0]: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
example[1]: Ollie gasped with pain and slumped forward.
example[2]: The audience gasped at the splendour of the costumes.
definition[1]: to breathe quickly in a way that can be heard because you are having difficulty breathing
example[3]: Brendan climbed slowly, gasping for breath.
definition[2]: when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
example[4]: She gave a little gasp and clutched George’s hand.
example[5]: With a gasp of pure horror, Lewis jumped up and ran.
definition[3]: when you breathe in air quickly because you are having difficulty breathing
example[6]: Her breath came in shallow gasps.
